WASHINGTON, DC. The Ma
tional Council of Negro Women,
was upset by the resignation of
two vice sidents who quit the
prestige group in the wake OF
the revelation that the Council S
trea sury is in the hole for close
to SAB 900.


DR.. Deborah Partridge Wolfe
of New York said in her resigna-
ton that she was amazed to
learn both of the deficit and the
fact that new per sonnet had been
added to the organization recently
without the approval of the board
of directors.

With the postal delivery more
than 100000 envelopes contain
ing sheets of gaily illustrated
seals and accompanying appeals,
the Greater Maricopa Tubercu-
losis and Health Association
opened it's 10th annual Christmas
Seal campaign! Proceeds are
used to carry on the fight against
TB and other respiratory dis
ca ses, the illnesses of breathing.


In a statement empha sizing the
gradual rate at which TBi being
pushed back, the local campaign
chairman. Glenn Stapley, said,--
Federal Health authorities have
called attention during the last
year to a slowing down of the rate
of decrea Sc in new active cases.
In Maricopa County, the incidence
of Tuberculo sis ha increa sed for
three years In roW--1rom oO4
new active ca ses reported in
1862, to $50 in 1868. Already this
year, a of November E, we are
38 cases ahead of la st year the
same date. This means need
for redoubling of efforts in pre-
vention, case finding and treat
ment.'


eat the same time, other ser
ious respiratory disea ses such
as chronic bronchitis and empty
soma present an increa sing prob
lem," MIR. Stapley continued. In
this work we hope to play our
part as we have done for many
years and we are confident that
the people in the community who
have supported us in the pa st will
show that they are with us more
than ever this year."

COLUMBIA, Sc, South Caro-
lima Baptists, in convention re-
iects recommendation by their
general board that admission pol
icies at the four state Baptist
colleges be left to the respective
trustees.


Approval of the recommend
alton would have opened way for
integration.


The convention rejected the
recommendation 943 to 9l5. The
schools are Furman University
at Greenville, Anderson College
at Anderson, North Creenville
Junior College in Upper Green
Vile County and the new Bap-
fist College of Charleston.
